answers.answer: Hello,yes, rapid changes in blood sugar can make you feel bad (ie. symptoms of low, even when you are not low).Also if you are only just now treating diabetes, numbers that are not low (ie. 80-120), can feel low because your body is used to being high.I have even found that feeling anxious about going low can make me 'feel low' though I am not.  In these cases I always test first before eating something because I can trust my blood sugar meter more than I can trust how I am feeling.

question: would I have symptoms due to the speed of dropping glucose when I am not that low?
title: speed of glucose dropping
